comments.body: WE LOVE COPPER

Yes. This would allow for more customizabilty.

I had the exact same idea! This would allow for anyone wanting a bit more customization and optimization of copper golems sorting to be able to configure entire logic channels. This is a much better and simple solution for even the newest of players to understand, unlike any other ideas of needing to configure some sort of linking to certain chests. This will allow a lower barrier to entry for more complex sorting solutions to be made by the community instead of pushing players to learning complex redstone contraptions.

Ah, this is a really good suggestion!
Not only will sorting become much more versatile, but it also plays well with the mechanics of the game.
Peak idea

well then an item that causes oxidation if this is added would be NOICE

so you can change a copper golem's target if want them to work on a diff line

Also the rain system could be changed so we can have light, medium and heavy rain in addition to thunderstorms. The difference between these three types of rain is just the amount of particles and droplets falling from the sky; moreover things like cauldron filling or other rain dependent things could be affected differently based on the intensity of the rain.

As for point 1, We can make golems which are living, we can make end crystals that bring back the end dragon, we can craft the wither. Creating life isn't a new thing to minecraft, and the dried ghast is made with ghast tears, the thing that makes regeneration potions and End crystals.

I think you are right. I used to think the same but from what i see Mojang is telling us that soul sand have life in it. By adding Ghast Tears, you mix life with Ghast DNA. I do not agree with crafting a mob (not summoning) but it make sense. your and their point of view is matching with Minecraft. The only problem and you mentionned it, is exploration but since they can't breed and there are expensive finding them stay a good way to have them. If it was up to me, i'd remove the craft and make em breedable (breeding drops dried ghast)
Along with the main suggestion, being able to make a telescope with the spyglass and sticks that make a tripod.

Along with the main suggestion, it could render chunks a little further from the actual render distance, allowing players to ACTUALLY SEE far away. Not... just the same they already see but with zoom.

I have the same problem with the Happy Ghast's name. My suggestion is to rename it to the Blithe. It's as equally strange & old a word as Ghast, and it holds the opposite meani g to the word Ghast.
Maybe the new name could fit into the Ghast's pun of being (A) Ghast and could be (A) Loft or something like that.
That other guy's idea of it being called the Blithe sounds good. Might post it as a separate suggestion.
It should be called the "Glee" instead.

Independently I thought of Gale considering 

1. Still begins with a G

2. Gale can refer to an outburst of laughter which I think gets across the happy attribute

3. Gale kind of relates to it being a light creature and its ability to fly similar to wind

 

I also like the other persons suggestion of Blithe tho and think it may match better in definition but I feel people would mispronounce it more often

I think something like Ghasper (or Gasper) could fit:

  1. The mob often makes breathy, gasp-like sounds.
  2. A "gasper" is a kind of ventilation outlet used in aircraft.
  3. The mob can help players see breath-taking views.
  4. Rhymes with "Casper", like the friendly ghost.
  5. Makes "ghast" sound like a later, degraded version of the name (Ghasper -> Ghasp -> Ghast)
Ghasper just sounds like a gasping ghast... Even worse. I like the idea of something like 'Blithe'.
I gotta say, I agree with this. Renaming it the Blithe is a good suggestion, but Gale sounds super good too! I just think there's SOME better name than "Happy Ghast" out there...
The "happy ghast" just sounds pathetic and immature even for minecraft.
Honeycomb is already useful for maintaining copper at a specific aesthetic state. I feel like this would unfairly penalize players who want a golem to harmonize with a specific build palette.

I fully agree. This is one of the biggest appeals from the original concept (building element/statue). I'm a little surprised they didn't add it from the start. It would make waxing copper golems make sense and would fit the overall 'theme' of copper better.
If the golem is actually concious that would be cruel. Otherwise I would love little statues of all kind of creatures in the game for decoration and such.
I think they planned on doing so from the start, but only implemeted it last week

Great idea. Rain is considered water in other parts of the game too: cauldrons can fill with rain, riptide can be used in the rain, and zombies and skeletons don‚Äôt burn when it‚Äôs raining. Allowing dried ghosts to hydrate in the rain would be consistent with these features.
Ghasts are not gohsts!
it would never rain long enough to hydrate the dried ghast, it never rains for 20 minutes, so when it stops raining, all your progress would be reset, making this feature practically useless
Huh. As a risky way to get rain detectors? Niche, but neat.
It would be a problem when using the dried ghast for decoration. If I make a statue out in the open using a dried ghast, for example, it would hydrate and could ruin the statue.

I think that change would be fun, but it would be a little slower, because if they changed it, before it would be: wooden pickaxe, then stone pickaxe, and then mining iron, but if they update it to your idea, it would be: wood, stone, copper, and iron.

It would make sense from a historical perspective as well; human civilization went from the stone age to the copper age first, then bronze followed by iron. It may be viewed as an inconvenience to some, but it would cement copper tools as necessary.

Either this, or there should be another block that Copper can mine but Stone can't... because as it stands, Copper cannot mine Gold, Emerald, or Redstone, and this sort of defeats the purpose as a middle ground between Stone and Iron, if aside from durability, it faces the very same restrictions as Stone... so adding at least one more of these, Redstone probably being the best choice that can still be mined before requiring Iron for the rest.

I fully agree with this idea; requiring players to craft a copper pickaxe to mine iron ore would have copper tools see some real use instead of being skipped over. Here‚Äôs my take on the idea:

As it is, both copper and iron ore can be mined using a stone pickaxe. And, because both copper and iron are very common and generate at similar y-levels, there is little incentive to make copper tools. Iron tools are superior to copper in every way, and there‚Äôs just no reason to mine and smelt copper when you could mine and smelt iron instead. If nothing is done with copper tools to make them more useful and unique, they will end up being ignored just as hard as gold tools are, and bloat the game with more useless items.

Requiring a copper pickaxe to mine iron ore would incentivize players to make and use copper tools. It would give copper a necessary role in progression, add more content to the early game, and spice up the ore progression tree, which has remained stagnant for well over a decade (excluding Netherite).

Admittedly, this isn‚Äôt a full solution to the problem. If this change were implemented, and copper pickaxes were needed to mine iron, the two ores generate so often and near each other that copper would fall in the same boat as wooden tools; copper tools would become transitional items that are created and discarded within minutes, without seeing any real use.

Along with this change, the distribution of iron ore generation would also need to change to balance the early game.
Nah. Copper tools are there for casual players and that‚Äôs okay

Okay, I really like this. I'm all for more lodestone features, I've suggested adding these compasses to the fishing table, and following the compass blindly to a structure nearby. A lot of structures would benefit from adding a lodestone into their design to make them easier to find. Trail Ruins especially.

I think a better option may be one suggested by TangoTek on stream (2nd of July).

That is that chests can have filter slots which you can place ghost items in to say "this chest will accept items of this type" even if there are none presently in the chest

I agree with this. Alongside it, though, maybe they should make it to where it puts items into groups, so that instead of having to have a chest full of apples because you have an apple in the item frame, it would be that it sorts all etible matirials into the chest. (sorry I spelled etible and matirials wrong english is hard lol)
this would be great for hopper based storage systems where every chest will end up empty!

As a bonus, copper golems don't need to scan chests, they can see if a chest has an item frame with a matching item and go straight to it before checking chests without item frames. You could add multiple item frames to a chest to accept multiple items. Really I'd love for there to be multi-item frames anyway, and they could add those and also this functionality together.

It feels minecraft-y enough that it fits in.

There is also the option of signs where you can have tags and such but that's not minecraft-y, although would absolutely be appreciated, stick a #tuff sign on a chest and now all tuff stuff goes there.

I actually really loved this part of the original concept. I think copper golem statues should come from the golem itself fully oxidizing. Personally I think this should be something the player has to keep on top of, they have to maintain their golems as a part of the balancing. However if they really want this to be fully automated then I'm not against them being wax-able. Additionally it'd be really cool if there would be some small structures with oxirdised golems in it midway through sorting to educate the player on what a copper golem is and what it does, would also be cool world building and a great archaeology spot.

Consider an alternative - a copper golem that stands on a lode stone deactivates until  it is pushed off of the lode stone.

I agree. You should be able to see the experience bar. The level should be shown at the exactly same place. I don't really see why this shouldn't be changed.

Very yes. It would be cool to just have the locator bar icons render above the experience bar directly. It might impede visibility of the bar when lots of players are on, but one could maybe have all those vanish when sneaking to see the regular experience bar.

I personally don't like the locator bar but from a conventional and game design perspective this makes no sense. 1 you already have the number above the bar which gives you a rough estimate on what you have and 2 there would be no good looking way that i can think of to blend the two and having both would just take up an unnecessary amount of space
Let's not forget invincibility potions. I really want stealth bombers in the game

About the invisibility potions, the harnesses visible and given the effect using commands. And the attribute command does not affect the speed of the happy ghast, which might be the reason why the speed affect does not work.

Given the seemingly universal disappointment at this not being possible, I sincerely hope that Mojang reconsiders this and allows the speed potions given the huge potential for how much fun it could be and the possibilities it would allow.

Today's snapshot confirmed that potions not working in general was in fact a bug, and as predicted players immediately tried to see if speed potions would work (and were once again disappointed when they do not).

"Balance" it if you must by having a cooldown debuf, or make the speed potion harmful so that you have to wait for their health to regenerate before using another one, or give it a speed buff with a duration timer after the happy ghast comes in contact with water (or when it's raining), but just do something as there are lots of possibilities for this new mob to go from being "pretty good" to just "epic" by making this a reality.
